runs.comm: a loose drive to one outside off stump zips down to third man
full, driven firmly to mid-off, never with enough oomph to pierce the field
full, straight and driven to extra cover who is three or four yards closer than usual
dropped towards backward point with soft hands, a mix-up with the calling but they get away with it as the throw goes to the wrong end
wide, a slashing drive gets a thick inside edge into his pads
tight, Prior goes back and can only block and Chigumbura follows through to prevent the single
too short, too wide, Maddy cuts over the infield, four on any other day but the outfield remains a complete pudding and the ball pulls up short
slower, pushed into the leg side, short midwicket on it like a panther
swung from middle behind square on the leg side - the short boundary - and it's four all the way
short and wide, steered to third man
firm drive past a diving cover, it beats the man and that's got the power to beat the slow outfield
pulled to square leg where the fielder makes a good, diving semi-stop
one step... and one bounce over long-on with a huge drive, crouching down and launching off the back foot
minimal footwork, stepping late and swishing as the ball had already gone through just outside off
goes to hit it over cover, but mis-times and doesn't get the distance nor height - Matsikenyeri does, though, leaping high to take it well
gone first ball! Edged a huge nick through to the keeper, looking to launch a huge cover-drive out of the ground
starts from wideish of his crease, nips it back in from off, Pietersen leaves it - his big shoulders full of intent
short from Chigumbura and climbs awkwardly, Pietersen cutting off the back foot into the ground, too late on the shot to get much purchase
spearing down leg, low, turned it off the legs behind square
on the money, defended on the front foot with a barn door of a bat, figuratively speaking naturally
driven out to mid-on
on the back foot, defended down into the ground
cut into the ground
worked behind point for a comfortable two
the lesser-spotted flamingo from Pietersen, reaching out to outside off and wristing it off the legs through midwicket
worked to cover for a well-taken single
the steepler and Pietersen gets away with it, the ball not coming on and he's down on one knee to launch over extra cover, where it plugs
right over cover this time
short and pulled away behind square
slower ball outside off, flashes a cut at it
whipped over square leg to end a useful over for England
a clean strike over long-on into the grass seating area
driven to long-off
looked to go over the top but holed out at cow corner for a well-watched catch, eight yards in from the boundary
nudged to cover for a quick one
an inside-edged drive to backward square leg
up and over, that went a long way indeed over long-on
nice looping start, but met with a patient drive to mid-on
patient again, driven to mid-off
driven out for another quick single
worked through midwicket
driven to long-off this time
worked out on the leg-side again, to deep square to be precise
starts with a bit of a dobble, dragging a touch short, gets away with a single through midwicket, pulled round
short wide, Collingwood drives strongly through cover and Keith Dabengwa on the extra cover boundary does extraordinarily well
huge lbw shout as the ball knocks Pietersen on the knee. Ouch
driven out to mid-on
Prioresque bark of "One" for, well, one to long-on. An easy one
low on middle stump, Pietersen moves outside off and sweeps audaciously behind square. Outrageous confidence, and more than gets away with it - sumptuous timing
swept to midwicket
down the track, driven to mid-on
looking, looking, no as Collingwood creeps down and presents a (Stuart) broad bat in defence
driven out to long-on, Collingwood setting off as soon as he hits it
down, down and a drive to cover this time, Collingwood again scampering into the shot
comes down again and meets the ball outside off, before driving it back out to mid-on
driven out to long-on
there's no room for error and Pietersen dispatches that lesson there - as he launches wide of long-on. Not quite timed, mind
opens his shoulders, again doesn't quite time it, but the ball finds mid-off
another strike rortation now with a dab to the covers
launched to the covers this time, where it plugs deep again, then bobbles awkrwardly, the fielder doing well to watch
impishly nibbles a drive to mid-on and another quick single
short but not timed, patted back to the bowler
sharp footwork makes room to drive into the off side. Good running brings a single, albeit with a hint of hesitation?
good late adjustment from the bowler as Pietersen made room on the leg side, but to no avail. A superbly timed sweep brings another boundary
tries the reverse sweep, but gets away with it
down the leg side, Collingwood has a limp waft at it, but the wide is called
low full toss, clobbered into the covers
swung into the leg side, Pietersen barely reacts as Collingwood calls the single, but there's no danger of a run-out. And he's probably still sauntering to the crease now
short and thumped. Collingwood had oodles of time to swivel into position and deposit that over midwicket. Shot!
fuller length, better length, driven into the covers
loopy slower ball, shovelled into the leg-side. Clever variation
very wide of off stump and Pietersen attempts a steer down to third man. Big appeal for caught-behind, but the umpire shakes his head
fuller length, pushed down to long-on, and that's Pietersen's fifty. Well batted
short again from Brent, who's lost his way after yesterday's heroics, and that's paddled effortlessly behind square. England in command after their early alarms
what an incredible shot! Pietersen plays a full-blooded reverse pull, he was switching hands before the ball leaves the hand, and it whistles clean out of the middle!
same intent, not lofted this time. But what an eye. England are motoring now
that's sheer arrogance. The man had been placed back for the reverse shot, and he still took it on and won. Incredible confidence and skill, and Zimbabwe are struggling now
back to normality now. A big heave with a regular shot this time, but ironically it was the least well timed of the over
that's monstrous. Down on one knee and absolutely belted over midwicket. An 80 yard thump and the boundary rider had no hope
short and wide, but too wide for Pietersen to time properly as he swung into the ball. Maybe that's the secret when he's in this mood?
tighter line, and Collingwood misses with an off-side carve
he doesn't miss this time though - right in the slot for a big heave across the line. It came off the toe-end of the bat and wasn't timed by any means. But still plopped over the rope for six
more smearing across the line. Deep midwicket fields on the bounce, but the runs are coming at a torrent now
better line and length, another cross-batted clobber, but not timed this time
swishing hard, and a loud "oof!" from the keeper as the ball whistles past the blade and the off stump
clunked meatily into the covers. No standing on ceremony now for England's batsmen
whacked. That looked like one of my golf shots, heaved across the line and hooked over long-on
flicked out to midwicket and that's the 150 up for England. And the 100 partnership from 53 balls

another massive swipe but this time Pietersen doesn't get enough bat on it ... the ball spirals high into the outfield at deep extra cover, but is comfortably snaffled. Credit to Zimbabwe, they've been outstanding in the field in both matches, and that's a vital breakthrough
no timing for Flintoff's first ball, which he attempts to nurdle off the legs
short and outside off stump, punched off the back foot into the covers for a single. That's his favourite shot, apparently.
right over the ball, classical cover drive/push to keep the strike

a loose full toss, smeared out to deep point, and immediately Collingwood's looking for two. He's very quick between the wickets ... but not quick enough. Cracking throw from Taibu on the boundary's edge, and terrific work from Taylor to scoop and whip off the bails. Two quick wickets, and Zimbabwe have a chance to dent the momentum
opens the face and steers his first ball down to third man to get off the mark
slow, slow, slow full toss. Flintoff's eyes briefly lit up, but it dipped late and he merely turned it square for a single
dobbled onto a good length. Zimbabwe are keeping their cool so far
too far down the leg side. Neat take by Taylor though
another low full toss, steered out to midwicket
excellent slower-ball yorker to complete a successful over
thumped into the covers but straight to the fielder
canny bowling, Flintoff started down the pitch, so Utseya followed him and cramped him for room
swished out to midwicket for another single
steady bowling. Flintoff drives with circumspection and that's another single
tidy again, pushed down to long-off
dropped - that was short, and Flintoff climbed into it, but short cover can't cling on. Costly?
dropped! again! Identical shot, identical miss. Still, at least it's a boundary saved
wild smear, and mistimed for a single to backward square leg
dropped, but a really tough chance. An under-edge from Flintoff who was fooled by the change in pace. Clever bowling, but unlucky
there he goes! He wasn't going to hang around for long. Two steps down the pitch, and smacked high into the stands at long-on
He's out this time! A legcutter slower ball, Flintoff has another heave, and is comprehensively bowled. A look of bemusement as he leaves the crease
massive swipe, Shah makes room, opens his shoulders and clears cow corner by a distance. That's Mascarenhas's zone, but he's a magnanimous type
in the air again, but miscued this time - the ball swirls down to third man, and that's an excellent tumbling catch. Zimbabwe keeping themselves in touch with some cracking work in the field
walloped, but straight to the man at deep extra cover! That was right out of the middle of the bat - flat and tracer-like. He couldn't have hit it any better, but he's gone first ball ...
hat-trick ball is negotiated with a nibble outside off stump
nudged into the gap for Schofield's first international run in seven years
outside off, slower than Broad anticipated, and he misses with an attempted glide to third man. Lovely over, and successful too
a clever, loopy, slower ball. Schofield defends resolutely with an open face, and steers down to third man
fuller length on leg stump, and Broad punches down the ground for a single
slower ball again, a wild slash from Broad gets a thin outside edge, and is helped over the boundary by a despairing dive from third man

a baseball carve into the leg side, an instant call for two and Dabengwa fields and throws expertly from long-on. It's gone to the third umpire ... Broad's long strides can't make up the ground, and that's another late wicket. England could be bowled out here
cracking delivery, a slower-ball yorker, and Schofield has to play that straight back down the pitch
swung into the leg-side again - like Lance Klusener without the timing. Two more runs as the throw comes in and that's the end of that
